name: Reflective journal Entities
text:
week 7  
goals, activities and outcomes: 
my main priority is to successfully complete the cyber fundamentals academy programme 
and the training for vulnerability management solution tools. this week's objective for me as 
an intern at cybercx is to attend all of the meetings that are scheduled for me, as well as to 
successfully complete all of the duties mentioned on the timesheets that my team members 
made when i started my position. soc challenge by cyber defenders and several 
daily/weekly meetings with cybercx supervisors are some of the activities planned for this 
week. splunk use knowledge gained through lab instruction, a cyber education training 
session, and a review of the azure la outage were some of the results from this week. the 
boss of the soc challenge's cyber defender was our first assignment that week. the exercise 
basically resembled a capture-the-flag game where we had to use the splunk course material. 
we also attended a meeting in the academy regarding the masterclass on presentation skills, 
in which we essentially learned how to make a polished presentation to a client. by the end of 
the week, a meeting was set up with a managing consultant to discuss consulting with the 
snc privately (strategy and consulting). jakub, the programme manager, and i also 
reviewed and provided input on all of our training sessions, meetings, and courses over the 
previous two weeks. 
new knowledge, skills, and experiences: 
understanding splunk, producing good information security content, attending a consulting 
101 meeting, and reporting business goals, team goals, customer goals, and individual goals 
are some of the new things i learnt this week. i got to take part in "catch the flag," where you 
m a h d i  k o b e i s s i -  4 5 8 8 9 6 8 6  
 
 
p a g e  19 | 36 
 
are given a problem and must search for the solution on the splunk platform. it was 
fascinating and entertaining to finish. 
rewarding experience: 
capture the flag with my team members was incredibly satisfying and exciting for me since i 
could see the relationships growing and we were thinking more critically and logically 
because it was a team activity. 
difficult experience: 
as a new intern, i felt like i had a tonne of work to get done during the day and that i should 
finish it as soon as possible. this made it difficult for me to plan my lunch break time with 
my schedule this week, which led to my second challenging experience, which was trying to 
focus at the end of the day. so, that was a lesson well-learned. 
suggestions or feedbacks that i would like improved in the workplace: 
the soft skills, such as communication, language, and behaviour, are something i would like 
to develop at work. i have the impression that everyone at the company takes themselves way 
too seriously and that some people don't really put up a friendly front; they just want to do 
their task and leave. nevertheless, i think it's crucial to build a good rapport and bond with 
co-workers. 
tasks for the upcoming week: 
some duties and tasks to be completed next week include: 
- 
tenable training 
- 
tenable sessions 
- 
itil mss training (break, fix vs security incidents, and incident management 
process) 
 
 
m a h d i  k o b e i s s i -  4 5 8 8 9 6 8 6  
 
 
p a g e  20 | 36 
 
week 8 
goals, activities and outcomes: 
one of my current top priorities is to concentrate on expanding my knowledge in the area of 
cyber-related study and successfully finish all the prerequisite cyber-basics courses. i wanted 
to finish the tool training for vulnerability management this week. this week, i did tasks 
related to infrastructure libraries, mss training, and information technology. the results were 
that i acquired fundamental tool abilities that were tenable. 
new knowledge, skills, and experiences: 
i did several virtual labs with tenable.io this week and studied the basics of vulnerability 
scanning, which was something new i learned. there were three training sessions for the 
itil, and they covered break-fix versus security incidents, incident management procedures, 
and complex problems. 
rewarding experience: 
sky news visited cybercx this week to interview john lenarduzzi, the director of managed 
security services global and commercial, about cyber security. i was instructed to 
participate in the interview as a little video that would be narrated. it was quite exciting for 
two reasons. the first being that john, a senior employee of the organisation, was 
corresponding with me while they were interviewing me, and the second being that this is my 
first time participating in an interview. 
difficult experience: 
even while this week was significantly better than last week, i still had trouble organising my 
break times. even though it came a little after everyone else had left for their break, i still 
m a h d i  k o b e i s s i -  4 5 8 8 9 6 8 6  
 
 
p a g e  21 | 36 
 
managed to get mine. i mentioned this to my colleague emma, though, and she gave me 
advice on how to deal with the situation. 
suggestions or feedbacks that i would like improved in the workplace: 
the time management in the office may be something i would really like to improve, and i 
would really like us to have more access to online learning resources. 
tasks for the upcoming week: 
some of the tasks that have been lined up for me in the upcoming week include things such 
as: 
- 
essentials 8 session 
- 
1-1 session with the team leader to follow up on boarding with the clients 
- 
microsoft security compliance and identity fundamentals sc-900 
- 
introduction to service now  
- 
introduction to wire shark/ nmap 
- 
analysis of a threat intel report  
- 
end of month reporting  
 
week 9 
goals, activities and outcomes: 
since ms sentinel is the client's primary goal, i want to concentrate on it this week. this 
week i will be conducting an end of month report and giving it to the team leader. i will 
also be introduced to two new courses including an introduction to service now, which is a 
tool used in the company, and an introduction to wire shark/ nmap. i will also be 
completing a microsoft security compliance and identity fundamental sc-900 course 
followed by an essentials 8 session. to end the week off, i will be having a 1-1 session with 
the team leader to follow up on the on boarding of the clients.  
 
m a h d i  k o b e i s s i -  4 5 8 8 9 6 8 6  
 
 
p a g e  22 | 36 
 
new knowledge, skills, and experiences: 
this week i was insighted on a lot of new knowledges and experiences mostly from the 
microsoft course that i had completed earlier in the week. i have successfully completed an 
end of month report and presented it to the team leader who was satisfied of my work. i 
endured a lot of information from the introductory courses and the microsoft course that was 
required from me to complete according to my spreadsheet.  
rewarding experience: 
the fact that emma takes time out of her day to meet with me and teach me new things while 
also helping me comprehend topics that need clarification is why i really appreciate our 
shadow sessions. 
difficult experience: 
thankfully, this week i didn’t feel like i experienced anything difficult. although if i were to 
experience any difficulty during my time at cybercx, i would find ways to try and relieve 
my stress such as relieving pressure through exercise, or get engaged in social events to try 
and feel better, or spend some time with family and friends, and most importantly i would 
talk to someone on the team about it so i can get an insight on what i should do in this 
circumstance or what they would recommended me do for next time.  
suggestions or feedbacks that i would like improved in the workplace: 
some aspects of my job that i would like to improve are everyone dining together at lunch 
and starting discussions to get to know my co-workers much better since i think that will help 
us all get to know each other and form good relationships in the office, especially after a 
scary time like covid-19 
 
m a h d i  k o b e i s s i -  4 5 8 8 9 6 8 6  
 
 
p a g e  23 | 36 
 
tasks for the upcoming week: 
some of the duties that i will accomplish next week include: 
- 
weekly meetings with the team 
- 
starting with chris sanders- investigation theory course 
 
week 10 
goals, activities and outcomes: 
a meeting with the nsw soc-sentinel session, discussions on liquid files and how to 
distribute and manage meta data with a senior consultant, the weekly cybercx meeting, 
jorge's splunk demo, a business writing course, chris sanders investigation theory course 
and virtual labs are among the events happening this week. 
new knowledge, skills, and experiences: 
it was really interesting this week in understanding the chris sanders investigation theory 
course and as well as the virtual labs. our team had a broad discussion with a senior 
consultant relation to liquid files and how to distribute and manage the meta data.  
rewarding experience: 
this week, it was satisfying to know that i had written a business report effectively, and once 
the programme manager saw it, he was impressed by how effective and efficient my business 
writing skills were. this is all because to my colleague emma, who greatly assisted me. 
difficult experience: 
this week was pretty challenging for me, the reason being is that i have not been getting 
along with one of the senior analysts in my pod, and it really affected me that i was 
considering changing pods because of this reason. i enjoy working with cybercx and it is 
normal to have lots of ups in your workplace, at the same time it is normal to go through 
m a h d i  k o b e i s s i -  4 5 8 8 9 6 8 6  
 
 
p a g e  24 | 36 
 
some downfalls with some of your colleagues. i had stepped this up and taken it to the team 
leader who then gave me his word on trusting him to talk with the senior analyst without 
causing any more tension, and he did exactly according to his word.  
suggestions or feedbacks that i would like improved in the workplace: 
i think it would be very good if we could connect with the managers more and learn from 
them at work, therefore that is something i would like to alter. 
tasks for the upcoming week: 
some of the tasks that are required for the upcoming week include things such as: 
- 
daily standup meeting  
- 
weekly standup meeting   
- 
1-1 with team lead 
- 
1-1 with soc manager 
- 
it incident scenario  
- 
operational technology presentation  
- 
sleep and our health: mental health awareness series 
- 
professional headshot session 
 
week 11 
goals, activities and outcomes: 
my objective for the following week is to begin developing the siem tool exabeam for 
prioritising alerts. my primary objective for week 11 remains to increase my knowledge in 
the area of cybersecurity. i truly want to expand my knowledge so that i can someday work 
as a senior analyst. 
 
 
m a h d i  k o b e i s s i -  4 5 8 8 9 6 8 6  
 
 
p a g e  25 | 36 
 
new knowledge, skills, and experiences: 
this week was quiet interesting, i didn’t feel like i learnt anything new relating to the cyber 
field, although i did learn a few different things relating to mental health awareness series and 
how sleep can affect our health in a positive way.  
rewarding experience: 
this week, my 1-1 session with the team leader was spoken over on a quick game of 8 ball 
pool table. our office has a beautiful setting which allows you to gain a type of closeness 
with your colleagues over a game room that is set up to take your mind off things if needed 
and to also build a relationship whether it was with your leaders, colleagues or even clients. 
this really helped get the roughness off things especially after what happened to me last 
week with the senior analyst, which we kind of brushed over too. 
difficult experience: 
i am finding it really difficult when my team members or work colleagues from the same pod 
are working from home while myself along with a few others are in the office. this is 
because we are trying to build a positive relationship with others and learn from each other, 
as well as finish the assigned tasks from us and it is difficult when half the team is working 
from home while the other half has shown up in the office. 
suggestions or feedbacks that i would like improved in the workplace: 
something i really hope for the future is that everyone slowly begins working back from the 
offices rather than working from home. i really enjoy coming into work everyday and 
meeting with new people having conversations with my work colleagues rather than just 
talking to a screen while sitting at home. 
 
m a h d i  k o b e i s s i -  4 5 8 8 9 6 8 6  
 
 
p a g e  26 | 36 
 
tasks for the upcoming week: 
some of the tasks that are required from me according to the spread sheet and according to 
where i have left off it:  
- 
get access to servicenow  
- 
attend daily/weekly meetings  
- 
begin working on the exabeam tool 
 
week 12 
goals, activities and outcomes: 
some of the activities that have been laid out for me to work on include: 
- 
daily standup 
- 
weekly soc meeting 
- 
consulting presentation 
- 
team lunch 
- 
dealing with technology stress | mental health awareness series 
- 
3 year anniversary update with ceo 
- 
secposium talk session: cyber intelligence team 
- 
diwali celebration  
- 
1-1 talk with the team lead 
 
new knowledge, skills, and experiences: 
when i first looked at my schedule i knew this week was going to be filled with new and 
exciting things to learn and experience whether it was attend the weekly meetings, or listen to 
presentations or different talk sessions, i knew i would talk a lot out of this week and i was 
right. i learnt a lot about the cyber intelligence team, i continued the mental health awareness 
series that i began from last week, the consulting presentation was very informative and full 
of laughter as well which i was really happy about. 
 
m a h d i  k o b e i s s i -  4 5 8 8 9 6 8 6  
 
 
p a g e  27 | 36 
 
rewarding experience: 
what i was particularly happy about was that the while team went out for lunch together and 
when we sat down at the restaurant, we all kind of put work topics and information aside and 
just had a laugh with the team while enjoying a delicious meal. we began talking about our 
personal lives and what most of the colleagues were doing before they began working in 
cyber security or working for cybercx and i was surprised to say the least that some of my 
work colleagues didn’t seem like they had worked the types of job they had said they did. it 
was a really enjoyable hour.    
difficult experience: 
thankfully, i didn't feel like i went through anything challenging this week. however, if i 
were to run into any problems while i was working at cybercx, i would try to find ways to 
reduce my stress, such as working out to relieve pressure, participating in social activities to 
try and feel better, or spending time with family and friends. most importantly, though, i 
would talk to someone on the team about it so i could get their advice on what i should do in 
this situation or what they would advise me to do for the next time. 
suggestions or feedbacks that i would like improved in the workplace: 
something i would like to suggest to my workplace is that we have these types of lunches 
more often because i felt like not only did it relieve the stress and pressure off some of the 
work colleagues it also began building a closer connection with each other and allowed us to 
understand each other abit better and what everyone done outside of work etc.

week 8 
goals, activities and outcomes: 
one of my current top priorities is to concentrate on expanding my knowledge in the area of 
cyber-related study and successfully finish all the prerequisite cyber-basics courses. i wanted 
to finish the tool training for vulnerability management this week. this week, i did tasks 
related to infrastructure libraries, mss training, and information technology. the results were

i did several virtual labs with tenable.io this week and studied the basics of vulnerability 
scanning, which was something new i learned. there were three training sessions for the 
itil, and they covered break-fix versus security incidents, incident management procedures, 
and complex problems.

first time participating in an interview.

even while this week was significantly better than last week, i still had trouble organising my 
break times. even though it came a little after everyone else had left for their break, i still

it was really interesting this week in understanding the chris sanders investigation theory 
course and as well as the virtual labs. our team had a broad discussion with a senior 
consultant relation to liquid files and how to distribute and manage the meta data.  
rewarding experience: 
this week, it was satisfying to know that i had written a business report effectively, and once 
the programme manager saw it, he was impressed by how effective and efficient my business 
writing skills were. this is all because to my colleague emma, who greatly assisted me. 
difficult experience: 
this week was pretty challenging for me, the reason being is that i have not been getting 
along with one of the senior analysts in my pod, and it really affected me that i was 
considering changing pods because of this reason. i enjoy working with cybercx and it is 
normal to have lots of ups in your workplace, at the same time it is normal to go through 
m a h d i  k o b e i s s i -  4 5 8 8 9 6 8 6  
 
 
p a g e  24 | 36 
 
some downfalls with some of your colleagues. i had stepped this up and taken it to the team 
leader who then gave me his word on trusting him to talk with the senior analyst without 
causing any more tension, and he did exactly according to his word.  
suggestions or feedbacks that i would like improved in the workplace: 
i think it would be very good if we could connect with the managers more and learn from 
them at work, therefore that is something i would like to alter. 
tasks for the upcoming week: 
some of the tasks that are required for the upcoming week include things such as: 
- 
daily standup meeting  
- 
weekly standup meeting   
- 
1-1 with team lead 
- 
1-1 with soc manager 
- 
it incident scenario  
- 
operational technology presentation  
- 
sleep and our health: mental health awareness series 
- 
professional headshot session

children.name: week 11 goals,
children.text:
week 11 
goals, activities and outcomes: 
my objective for the following week is to begin developing the siem tool exabeam for 
prioritising alerts. my primary objective for week 11 remains to increase my knowledge in 
the area of cybersecurity. i truly want to expand my knowledge so that i can someday work 
as a senior analyst. 
 
 
m a h d i  k o b e i s s i -  4 5 8 8 9 6 8 6  
 
 
p a g e  25 | 36 
 
new knowledge, skills, and experiences: 
this week was quiet interesting, i didn’t feel like i learnt anything new relating to the cyber 
field, although i did learn a few different things relating to mental health awareness series and 
how sleep can affect our health in a positive way.  
rewarding experience: 
this week, my 1-1 session with the team leader was spoken over on a quick game of 8 ball 
pool table. our office has a beautiful setting which allows you to gain a type of closeness 
with your colleagues over a game room that is set up to take your mind off things if needed 
and to also build a relationship whether it was with your leaders, colleagues or even clients. 
this really helped get the roughness off things especially after what happened to me last 
week with the senior analyst, which we kind of brushed over too. 
difficult experience: 
i am finding it really difficult when my team members or work colleagues from the same pod 
are working from home while myself along with a few others are in the office. this is 
because we are trying to build a positive relationship with others and learn from each other, 
as well as finish the assigned tasks from us and it is difficult when half the team is working 
from home while the other half has shown up in the office. 
suggestions or feedbacks that i would like improved in the workplace: 
something i really hope for the future is that everyone slowly begins working back from the 
offices rather than working from home. i really enjoy coming into work everyday and 
meeting with new people having conversations with my work colleagues rather than just 
talking to a screen while sitting at home. 
 
m a h d i  k o b e i s s i -  4 5 8 8 9 6 8 6  
 
 
p a g e  26 | 36 
 
tasks for the upcoming week: 
some of the tasks that are required from me according to the spread sheet and according to 
where i have left off it:  
- 
get access to servicenow  
- 
attend daily/weekly meetings  
- 
begin working on the exabeam tool

children.name: week 12 goals,
children.text:
week 12 
goals, activities and outcomes: 
some of the activities that have been laid out for me to work on include: 
- 
daily standup 
- 
weekly soc meeting 
- 
consulting presentation 
- 
team lunch 
- 
dealing with technology stress | mental health awareness series 
- 
3 year anniversary update with ceo 
- 
secposium talk session: cyber intelligence team 
- 
diwali celebration  
- 
1-1 talk with the team lead 
 
new knowledge, skills, and experiences: 
when i first looked at my schedule i knew this week was going to be filled with new and 
exciting things to learn and experience whether it was attend the weekly meetings, or listen to 
presentations or different talk sessions, i knew i would talk a lot out of this week and i was 
right. i learnt a lot about the cyber intelligence team, i continued the mental health awareness 
series that i began from last week, the consulting presentation was very informative and full 
of laughter as well which i was really happy about. 
 
m a h d i  k o b e i s s i -  4 5 8 8 9 6 8 6  
 
 
p a g e  27 | 36 
 
rewarding experience: 
what i was particularly happy about was that the while team went out for lunch together and 
when we sat down at the restaurant, we all kind of put work topics and information aside and 
just had a laugh with the team while enjoying a delicious meal. we began talking about our 
personal lives and what most of the colleagues were doing before they began working in 
cyber security or working for cybercx and i was surprised to say the least that some of my 
work colleagues didn’t seem like they had worked the types of job they had said they did. it 
was a really enjoyable hour.    
difficult experience: 
thankfully, i didn't feel like i went through anything challenging this week. however, if i 
were to run into any problems while i was working at cybercx, i would try to find ways to 
reduce my stress, such as working out to relieve pressure, participating in social activities to 
try and feel better, or spending time with family and friends. most importantly, though, i 
would talk to someone on the team about it so i could get their advice on what i should do in 
this situation or what they would advise me to do for the next time. 
suggestions or feedbacks that i would like improved in the workplace: 
something i would like to suggest to my workplace is that we have these types of lunches 
more often because i felt like not only did it relieve the stress and pressure off some of the 
work colleagues it also began building a closer connection with each other and allowed us to 
understand each other abit better and what everyone done outside of work etc.
